intro: Mesosphaerum sideritis, commonly known as the ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Mesosphaerum sideritis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
